definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: Sadly enough, the generator was all but forgotten during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 但不幸的是，這些機器在二戰期間被完全遺忘廢置。

sentences.english: A secure, memorable password is easy for you to remember, and hard for others to guess.
sentences.chinese: 安全可靠又難以遺忘的密碼應該是易記且難猜的。

sentences.english: Praise God that He loves the oft-forgotten elderly.
sentences.chinese: 感謝神，祂的慈愛遍及被人遺忘的老人。

sentences.english: Thee sandglass remembers the time we lost.
sentences.chinese: 㦱沙漏記得，我們遺忘的時光。

sentences.english: She will just fall like a grain of dust into oblivion.
sentences.chinese: 她將只是那一粒被遺忘的塵埃。

sentences.english: It also shows the Iranian authorities that people care and won't let them be forgotten," said Laura Fattal, mother of Josh Fattal.
sentences.chinese: 同時表明人民關心的伊朗當局不會讓他們被遺忘”。

sentences.english: Oblivion, the foundation of this city.
Us is the freeborn Brit or the forgotten men and women of America.
sentences.chinese: 我們是生而自由的英國人或者美國被遺忘的人們。

sentences.english: Hark the knowledge of powers forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 聽被遺忘了的力量知識。

sentences.english: The Group of New Trend is a pearl which has been forgot.
sentences.chinese: 新潮社是一顆被遺忘的金沙驪珠。

sentences.english: Organic forms of amnesia are usually associated with dysfunction of the DIENCEPHALON or HIPPOCAMPUS. (From Adams et al.
sentences.chinese: 遺忘症的器質形式通常與間腦或海馬的功能障礙有關。

sentences.english: You can best use board-mount miniature POTs for anything you want to set-and-forget.
sentences.chinese: 您可以使用電路板式可變電阻讓您安心的遺忘它。

sentences.english: The earth and the sunshine are something everlasting which could never be forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 大地和陽光是絕然不會被遺忘的永恆。

sentences.english: Just a little, but caught wind says to want to forget himself, and cause contacts.
sentences.chinese: 只是阿一卻撞見小風說要遺忘本人，和大業交往。

sentences.english: How do you find a thing you have mislaid or forgotten?
sentences.chinese: 你如何找回你已經錯失或遺忘的東西哩？

sentences.english: Birds rest in wild verdure where dusk forgets Qin's courts of yore;
sentences.chinese: 鳥兒棲息在野綠之中，此處的黃昏遺忘了古代的秦苑。

definition: once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
in the end/after all is said and done
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
to remember/to bear in mind/to learn by heart
